sen.j: 五十五世梅若六郎（うめわか ろくろう、1907年8月3日 - 1979年2月8日）は観世流シテ方能楽師、人間国宝、日本芸術院会員。
sen.e: Rokuro UMEWAKA, the 55th (August 3, 1907 – February 8, 1979), is a shite-kata (a main role) Noh actor of the Kanze school, Living National Treasure, and a member of the Japan Art Academy.

Rokuro UMEWAKA, the 55th (August 3, 1907 – February 8, 1979) was a Nohgakushi (Noh actor) playing shite (a principal role) of the Kanze-ryu school, Living National Treasure, and a member of the Japan Art Academy.
sen.cmt: 過去形にし、表現を合わせました。
sen.e: Rokuro UMEWAKA, the 55th (August 3, 1907 – February 8, 1979) was a Nohgakushi (Noh actor) playing shite (a principal role) of the Kanze-ryu school, Living National Treasure, and a member of the Japan Art Academy.
His former name is Rokunojo.
His former name was Rokunojo.
His former name was Rokunojo.

sen.j: 五十四世梅若六郎 (54世)（後の二代梅若実）の子として東京に生まれる。
sen.e: Born in Tokyo as a son of Rokuro UMEWAKA, the 54th (later Minoru UMEWAKA, the second).
Born in Tokyo as a son of Rokuro UMEWAKA, the 54th (later Minoru UMEWAKA, the second).
Born in Tokyo as a son of Rokuro UMEWAKA, the 54th (later Minoru UMEWAKA, the second).

sen.j: 祖父は明治三名人の一人、初代梅若実。
sen.e: His grandfather is Minoru UMEWAKA, the first, one of the three masters of the Meiji period.
His grandfather was Minoru UMEWAKA, the first, one of the three masters of the Meiji period.
His grandfather was Minoru UMEWAKA, the first, one of the three masters of the Meiji period.

sen.j: 弟に梅若雅俊、梅若恭行。
sen.e: His younger brothers are Masatoshi UMEWAKA and Yasuyuki UMEWAKA.
His younger brothers were Masatoshi UMEWAKA and Yasuyuki UMEWAKA.
His younger brothers were Masatoshi UMEWAKA and Yasuyuki UMEWAKA.
His second son is Rokuro UMEWAKA (the 56th).
His second son is Rokuro UMEWAKA (the 56th).
His second son is Rokuro UMEWAKA (the 56th).
In 1911 debut as a priest in 'Tadanobu'.
1911: Debuted as a priest role in 'Tadanobu.'
1911: Debuted as a priest role in 'Tadanobu.'
In 1915 first shite-kata experience in 'Kikujido' (The Boy with Chrysanthemums).
1915: Performed shite in 'Kikujido' (The Boy with Chrysanthemums) for the first time.
sen.cmt: 年表表示にし、表現を合わせました。
sen.e: 1915: Performed shite in 'Kikujido' (The Boy with Chrysanthemums) for the first time.
In 1918 graduated from Asakusaseibi Higher Elementary School.
sen.cmt: 「浅草精美高等小学校」はAsakusaseibi elementary schoolとなっていますが、『研究社新和英大辞典第5版』では、「高等小学校」はa higher elementary schoolというようですので、higherを追加しました。
sen.e: 1918: Graduated from Asakusaseibi Higher Elementary School.
1918: Graduated from Asakusaseibi Higher Elementary School.
In 1925 performed 'Dojoji' (Dojo-ji Temple).
1925: Performed 'Dojoji' (Dojo-ji Temple).
1925: Performed 'Dojoji' (Dojo-ji Temple).
In 1928 performed 'Okina' (An Old Man).
1928: Performed 'Okina' (An Old Man).
1928: Performed 'Okina' (An Old Man).
In 1944 succeeded to Rokuro UMEWAKA, the 55th.
1944: Succeeded to Rokuro UMEWAKA, the 55th.
1944: Succeeded to Rokuro UMEWAKA, the 55th.

sen.j: 57年能楽協会理事、重要無形文化財（人間国宝）指定。
sen.e: In 1957 a board member of the Nohgaku Performers' Association, designated as a holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure).
1957: A board member of the Nohgaku Performers' Association, designated as a holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure).
1957: A board member of the Nohgaku Performers' Association, designated as a holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure).

sen.j: 58年「船弁慶」のシテにより芸術祭文部大臣賞受賞。
sen.e: In 1958 received the Minister of Education Award for Fine Art for his shite-kata performance of 'Funa Benkei' (Benkei in the Boat).
1958: Received the Minister of Education Award for Fine Art for his shite performance of 'Funa Benkei' (Benkei in the Boat).
1958: Received the Minister of Education Award for Fine Art for his shite performance of 'Funa Benkei' (Benkei in the Boat).
In 1959 received the Osaka Cultural Festival Award.
1959: Received the Osaka Cultural Festival Award.
1959: Received the Osaka Cultural Festival Award.

sen.j: 60年梅若能楽学院を創立、理事長となる。
sen.e: In 1960 founded Umewaka Nogaku Gakuin (Umewaka Noh School) and became an administrative director.
1960: Founded Umewaka Nohgaku Gakuin (Umewaka Noh School) and became an administrative director.
1960: Founded Umewaka Nohgaku Gakuin (Umewaka Noh School) and became an administrative director.

sen.j: 大阪府芸術祭奨励賞受賞。
sen.e: Received the Art Encouragement Prize by Osaka Prefecture.
Received the Art Encouragement Prize by Osaka Prefecture.
Received the Art Encouragement Prize by Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 62年長唄の吉住慈恭、地唄舞の武原はんと「きさらぎ会」を結成。
sen.e: In 1962 formed 'Kisaragi Kai' (a group named 'the second month of the lunar calendar') along with Jikyo YOSHIZUMI of nagauta (long epic song with shamisen accompaniment) and Han TAKEHARA of jiutamai (jiuta dance).

1962: Formed 'Kisaragikai' (a group named the second month of the lunar calendar) along with Jikyo YOSHIZUMI of nagauta (long epic song with shamisen accompaniment) and Han TAKEHARA of jiutamai (jiuta dance).

1962: Formed 'Kisaragikai' (a group named the second month of the lunar calendar) along with Jikyo YOSHIZUMI of nagauta (long epic song with shamisen accompaniment) and Han TAKEHARA of jiutamai (jiuta dance).

sen.j: 64年東京オリンピック芸術部門参加。
sen.e: In 1964 participated in the Art Department of Tokyo Olympics.
1964: Participated in the Art Department of Tokyo Olympics.
1964: Participated in the Art Department of Tokyo Olympics.
In 1965 performed in Europe.
1965: Performed in Europe.
1965: Performed in Europe.

sen.j: 67年ニューオーリンズ名誉市民、日本芸術院会員。
sen.e: In 1967 an honorary citizen of New Orleans, a member of the Japan Art Academy.
1967: An honorary citizen of New Orleans, a member of the Japan Art Academy.
1967: An honorary citizen of New Orleans, a member of the Japan Art Academy.
In 1968 performed in the United States and Mexico.
1968: Performed in the United States and Mexico.
1968: Performed in the United States and Mexico.
In 1976 received the Medal with Dark Blue Ribbon.
1976: Received the Medal with Dark Blue Ribbon.
1976: Received the Medal with Dark Blue Ribbon.
In 1977 received the Order of the Sacred Treasure, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon.
1977: Received the Order of the Sacred Treasure, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon.
1977: Received the Order of the Sacred Treasure, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon.

sen.j: 著書に『謡を始める人のために』（池田書店、1964）。
sen.e: Wrote a book "Utai wo hajimeru hito no tame ni" (for people who start Noh chanting) (Ikeda Shoten [Publisher], 1964).
sen.cmt: 『謡を始める人のために』は"Utai wo haimeruhito no tameni" (for people to start do Noh chanting)となっていますが、下線のローマ字に謝りもあり少し変えました。
sen.e: Wrote a book "Utai wo hajimeru hito no tame ni" (for people who start Noh chanting) (Ikeda Shoten [Publisher], 1964).
Wrote a book "Utai wo hajimeru hito no tame ni" (for people who start Noh chanting) (Ikeda Shoten [Publisher], 1964).
